line_1: A foe to care, but more a foe to thinking.
line_2: In one dull round of sleeping, eating, drinking,

line_1: And Hugh the town-writer, I'm thinking,
line_2: Will egg on the fighting and drinking

line_1: But he scarce reads his Bible, and never loves Thinking.
line_2: He told me his Dreams, talk'd of Eating and Drinking;

line_1: Who of our Victuals thus art Thinking,
line_2: If thou hast Care too of our Drinking,

line_1: There's monie godly folks are thinkin,
There's monie godly folks are thinkin,
line_2: The wale o' cocks for fun an' drinkin!

line_1: There's monie godly folks are thinkin,
line_2: Will send you, Korah-like, a sinkin,

line_1: But stroll'd to shun the toil of thinking;

line_2: At Tunbridge let us still be Drinking,
